alert.note: Alert for Dauphin (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 05 at 7:23AM EST until February 05 at 1:18PM EST by NWS State College
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Pennsylvania... Swatara Creek Above Middletown affecting Dauphin County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING THROUGH THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Swatara Creek Above Middletown. * WHEN...Until this afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Minor overbank flooding begins near the Vine Street Bridge downstream to the Susquehanna River. At 12.0 feet, Both banks overflow upstream of the Vine Street Bridge and several basements are affected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 AM EST Saturday the stage was 11.0 feet and falling. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:00 AM EST Saturday was 13.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall to around 5 feet Monday evening. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 130 PM EST.
